title: Composition
text: Remember that to solve $$f(f(-2))$$, we need to first find the value of $$f(-2)$$, then plug that value back in to f(x).

title: Finding $$f(-2)$$
text: To find $$f(-2)$$, we need to plug in $$-2$$ for the $$x$$ in the function f: (2(-2)**2)+1. What does this evaluate to?

subHints.title: Exponents
subHints.text: Based off the Order of Operations, the first step is the exponent: $${\left(-2\right)}^2=4$$.

subHints.title: Multiplication
subHints.text: Now, our expression reads $$2\times4+1$$. The next step is the multiplication: $$2\times4=8$$.

subHints.title: Addition
subHints.text: Lastly, our expression is $$8+1$$, which is equal to $$9$$.

title: Finding $$f(f(-2))$$
text: Our next step is to plug the value of $$f(-2)$$ into f. In other words, we are evaluating f(9).

title: Finding $$f(f(-2))$$
text: To find $$f(-2)$$, we need to plug in $$-2$$ for the $$x$$ in the function f: (2(-2)**2)+1. What does this evaluate to?
